page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW - PETWORTH NE
page.content: This is an outstanding area of beautiful rolling countryside dominated by many trees, but very sparsely populated. Many farms of all sizes from 15 to 550 acres are scattered around. About 30% of the area is still deciduous woodland, remnants of the original Wealden Forest. East of the A272 road woods are being sold off and houses built to owners' designs and requirements. This is the most prosperous part. Land to the west is part of the Leconfield Estate. The whole district gives an impression of peace and charm; it is not under an air route and summer traffic noise on the main road is muted by distance. Apart from the new housing and necessary modern innovations, life style in this area seems to have remained mainly unchanged for hundreds of years.
